title: Loss is higher after loading pretrained weights
body:
Hi, I really appreciate this repository. It owns a clear organizational structure and rich features. When I trained SSD300 on COCO2017 with EfficientNet-B3 as backbone 
```
MODEL:
  NUM_CLASSES: 81
  BACKBONE:
    NAME: 'efficient_net-b3'
    OUT_CHANNELS: (48, 136, 384, 256, 256, 256)
  PRIORS:
    FEATURE_MAPS: [37, 18, 9, 5, 3, 1]
    STRIDES: [8, 16, 32, 64, 100, 300]
    MIN_SIZES: [21, 45, 99, 153, 207, 261]
    MAX_SIZES: [45, 99, 153, 207, 261, 315]
    ASPECT_RATIOS: [[2], [2, 3], [2, 3], [2, 3], [2], [2]]
    BOXES_PER_LOCATION: [4, 6, 6, 6, 4, 4]
INPUT:
  IMAGE_SIZE: 300
DATASETS:
  TRAIN: ("coco_2017_train", "coco_2017_val")
  TEST: ("coco_2017_val", )
SOLVER:
  MAX_ITER: 600000
  LR_STEPS: [420000, 540000]
  GAMMA: 0.1
  BATCH_SIZE: 32
  LR: 1e-3

OUTPUT_DIR: 'outputs/efficient_net_b3_ssd300_coco2017'
```
I found a confusing thing: Initial loss would be lower (from 100 to 30) if I commented this line in _ssd/modeling/backbone/efficient_net/utils.py_
>  model.load_state_dict(state_dict, strict=False)

What do you think of this phenomenon and could you please share your loss graph on COCO? Here is mine.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37063154/62593644-1edb2280-b90a-11e9-9e51-deb613b5b662.png)
